org.apache.spark.network.shuffle

Class ShuffleClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.spark.network.shuffle.ShuffleClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExternalShuffleClient

    public abstract class ShuffleClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Provides an interface for reading shuffle files, either from an Executor or external service.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShuffleClient() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void fetchBlocks(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String execId, java.lang.String[] blockIds, BlockFetchingListener listener)
      Fetch a sequence of blocks from a remote node asynchronously, Note that this API takes a sequence so the implementation can batch requests, and does not return a future so the underlying implementation can invoke onBlockFetchSuccess as soon as the data of a block is fetched, rather than waiting for all blocks to be fetched.
      void init(java.lang.String appId)
      Initializes the ShuffleClient, specifying this Executor's appId.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShuffleClient

        public ShuffleClient()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(java.lang.String appId)
        Initializes the ShuffleClient, specifying this Executor's appId. Must be called before any other method on the ShuffleClient.

      • fetchBlocks

        public abstract void fetchBlocks(java.lang.String host,
                                 int port,
                                 java.lang.String execId,
                                 java.lang.String[] blockIds,
                                 BlockFetchingListener listener)
        Fetch a sequence of blocks from a remote node asynchronously, Note that this API takes a sequence so the implementation can batch requests, and does not return a future so the underlying implementation can invoke onBlockFetchSuccess as soon as the data of a block is fetched, rather than waiting for all blocks to be fetched.
